alert.note: Alert for Bennington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 13 at 3:23PM EDT until September 13 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Bennington County in southern Vermont... * Until 430 PM EDT. * At 323 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Salem to near Arlington to near Hoosick Falls, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Arlington, Manchester, Shaftsbury, Dorset, Manchester Center, North Bennington, Sunderland, Rupert, Sandgate, Peru, Glastenbury, Paper Mill Village, Sodom, Beartown, Chiselville, South Shaftsbury, Barnumville, West Rupert, Hidden Valley and Bromley Village. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
